forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 51. Southwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 7 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

weather_report:
As the night unfurls over Downtown San Francisco, a subtle breeze wafts through the city, accompanied by the gentle rustle of leaves in the dim light. Tonight, the skies remain partly cloudy, a soft gray veil muted by the silver glow of ambient city lights. The temperature dips to a pleasant low of around 51, inviting a lightweight jacket or a cozy sweater—perfect for an evening stroll along the waterfront or a quiet moment in one of the many hidden cafés. 

Tomorrow promises the sun’s radiant embrace, with clear skies allowing for a spirited day ahead. As the morning light floods the city, temperatures are expected to peak near 63 in the early hours, gently cooling to a comfortable 60 by afternoon. Southwest winds will dance through the streets, offering a refreshing lift against the backdrop of the iconic skyline. It's a day made for simple pleasures—one might wander through the Mission District, savoring the slow rhythm of life, or perhaps take a scenic trek up to Twin Peaks for a panoramic view that stretches all the way to the Pacific. With the marine layer holding back any stubborn fog, it’s an opportune moment to embrace the vibrancy of San Francisco, draped in the warmth of the sun and a hint of discovery.
